metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15751 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
SaltStack Salt before 2017.7.8 and 2018.3.x before 2018.3.3 allow remoteattackers to bypass authentication and execute arbitrary commands viasalt-api(netapi).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
salt-cloud - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
salt-common - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
salt-master - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
salt-minion - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
salt-proxy - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
salt-ssh - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
salt-syndic - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: salt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2').
